intro: Tragia obtusata, commonly known as the bluntleaf tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Tragia obtusata is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
